alert.note: Alert for Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 27 at 6:01AM AKDT until March 28 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected with blizzard conditions over higher terrain. Freezing rain possible this morning. Additional snow accumulation 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Visibility one quarter mile or less a times. Ice accumulation of a light glaze possible. * WHERE...Upper Koyukuk Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow over higher terrain will develop tonight. The heaviest snow, strongest winds and worst visibility is expected over higher terrain.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
